resources.string: The McGill Hong Kong Student Network is a student-run organization officially founded in 2006. With over 400 members this year, the vision of the network is to connect students within the McGill student body to Hong Kong by building bridges that facilitate the integration of our members within the Hong Kong community for all purposes including travel and work.

\t\tThe Hong Kong Student Network strives to welcome new students from all over the world and showcase to them the wonderfulness that is McGill. We pride ourselves on being a home away from home, and we embrace the multiculturalism that Hong Kong is known for. \n\t\tOver the course of the semester, HKSN organizes a wide variety of events, from singing competitions to ski trips to showcase this sentiment. We hope that everyone who joins HKSN will have an awesome time and meet lots of new people! \n\t\tOur membership cards provide deals from over 25+ sponsors that are displayed in this app, purchase one today for only 5$!.

Email: mcgillhksn@gmail.com 
Website: hksn.ca 
Office Hours: 
SSMU Building Suite 408 
Tues - Thur 2-6PM

A Japanese pub where appetizer-size dishes are served one at a time and shared. This style of dining lets guests relax and enjoy themselves while sharing a variety of small dishes. Montreal\'s finest Izakaya.
3000 St Catherine Street West, Montreal, Canada
